title: Object Pronouns
subtitle: Lo, la, le and more
objectives: Understand direct object pronouns (lo, la, los, las)
Understand indirect object pronouns (me, te, le, nos, les)

screens.heading: Why Use Object Pronouns?
screens.content: Object pronouns replace nouns to avoid repetition. Instead of 'I see the book. I read the book,' we say 'I see it. I read it.'
screens.tip: In Spanish, pronouns go BEFORE the conjugated verb (unlike English where they come after).

screens.heading: Double Object Pronouns
screens.content: When using both, indirect comes before direct. LE/LES becomes SE before LO/LA/LOS/LAS:
screens.tip: Order: Indirect + Direct + Verb (Se lo doy = I give it to him)

screens.explanation: Le + lo = Se lo (le changes to se before lo/la)

examples.spanish: Voy a comprarlo = Lo voy a comprar
Necesito decirte algo = Te necesito decir algo
